keyMoments.title: Bellamy Pirates Attack Cricket's House
keyMoments.description: The Bellamy Pirates launch a coordinated attack on Mont Blanc Cricket's residence to steal his salvaged gold artifacts, with Bellamy leading the assault.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes the Bellamy Pirates as antagonists who will use violence to achieve their goals and mock those who pursue dreams.

keyMoments.title: Bellamy Pirates Steal Cricket's Gold
keyMoments.description: After defeating the Saruyama Alliance, the Bellamy Pirates successfully steal all of Cricket's gold artifacts that he collected over ten years of salvage work.
keyMoments.significance: The theft represents an attack on dreams and sets up the crew's downfall when Luffy confronts them.

reveals.information: Bellamy Pirates use coordinated attacks and rely on Bellamy's Devil Fruit superiority
Crew follows Bellamy's cynical philosophy that dreams are worthless in the 'new era'

keyMoments.title: Saruyama Alliance Defeated
keyMoments.description: The Saruyama Alliance fights to defend their home and Cricket's gold but are defeated by Bellamy's superior Devil Fruit powers. Despite their combined bounties totaling over 60 million berries, they cannot overcome Bellamy's spring attacks.
keyMoments.significance: Shows the alliance's loyalty to Cricket and their willingness to fight for their shared dreams, even against overwhelming odds.

keyMoments.title: Alliance Maintains Commitment to Straw Hats
keyMoments.description: Despite being beaten and robbed, the Saruyama Alliance maintains their commitment to helping the Straw Hats reach Sky Island, with Cricket insisting it's their duty.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the alliance's honor and their dedication to helping those who share their belief in dreams.

reveals.information: Alliance members are willing to sacrifice their treasure and endure defeat to maintain their honor and help the Straw Hats

keyMoments.title: Straw Hats Hunt for South Bird
keyMoments.description: The Straw Hat crew works together to capture a South Bird in Jaya's jungle, essential for their journey to Sky Island.
keyMoments.significance: Shows the crew's coordination and determination to prepare for their next adventure.

keyMoments.title: Straw Hats Stand Up for Their Allies
keyMoments.description: Upon discovering Cricket and the Saruyama Alliance beaten, Luffy immediately decides to confront Bellamy and retrieve the stolen gold, demonstrating the crew's loyalty to their friends.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes the Straw Hats' code of honor - they protect those who have helped them, regardless of the danger.

reveals.information: Luffy's bounty is now 100 million berries, Zoro's is 60 million berries
